Job.JobDescription:
About the Employer Welcome to Paramount Unified School District. Paramount strives to create a collaborative and supportive environment for our employees so that they may focus on our main goal to serve the needs and interests of our students. The District is comprised of 19 schools: eleven elementary schools, four middle schools, Paramount High School, as well as Odyssey High School STEM Academy, Buena Vista Alternative Learning, and Paramount Adult School. Paramount Unified also has a robust Early Childhood Education program for our youngest learners. District enrollment is approximately 11,500 students, of which 95% are unduplicated.
Job Summary Under the supervision of the Assistant Principal, Athletics and Athletics Director. The Head Coach is responsible for leading and managing the football program. This includes developing the skills of student-athletes, fostering teamwork, ensuring the physical and mental well-being of players, and promoting academic achievement alongside athletic success. The head coach will work closely with the athletics director, school administration, staff, and the community to ensure a positive and supportive environment for all participants.
Requirements / Qualifications Minimum Qualifications Previous coaching experience at the high school or higher level; Strong knowledge of coaching rules, techniques, and strategies; Excellent leadership, communication, and organizational skills; Ability to inspire and motivate student-athletes; Commitment to fostering a diverse and inclusive team environment. Your application must be accompanied by the following documents: • Updated (detailed) Resume of experience and training • Letters of Recommendation (Optional) Licenses & Other Requirements: Must possess a valid CPR and First Aid certification; Must pass a background check and complete all district and CIF required training and certifications. CIF Certificates - Fundamentals of Coaching - Protecting Students from Abuse - Concussion Certification - Sudden Cardiac Arrest - Heat Acclimatization Course • Resume
Comments and Other Information The Paramount Unified School District is an equal opportunity/ affirmative action employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, or gender in any of its policies, procedures or practices. See our website for full details. ** Must include professional/character/volunteer references on applications (contact information: name, job title, and contact information)** Incomplete applications will not be considered.

Job.JobDescription:
The YCHS Assistant Cross Country Coach position at Yuba City Unified School Dist. is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The YCHS Assistant Cross Country Coach is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At Yuba City Unified School Dist., coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The YCHS Assistant Cross Country Coach encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The YCHS Assistant Cross Country Coach also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the YCHS Assistant Cross Country Coach role at Yuba City Unified School Dist. is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.
